name: Lorien Hotel and Spa, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Lorien were amazing. Our stay began with a greeting from Shane our Valet. Shane parked our car and brought our bag up to our room so that we could begin our vacation. We checked in with a beautiful young women named Danielle. She greeted us with a lovely smile and after hearing we were there to celebrate our anniversary, upgraded our room. The room was clean, with an amazing view of the Masonic Temple. She recommended things for us to do. We walked down King Street with it's beautiful lights. Danielle suggested the Brabo restaurant and told us about the ice sculptures at Gaylord. The food was fantastic and the the ice sculptures were something we had never seen before. Shane our valet was there each time we left the hotel, very polite and charming. When we returned from our evening out chocolate covered strawberries and champagne awaited us in our room. We could not have had a better week. The staff at the Lorien made it feel like a honeymoon. Thank you Danielle and Shane for making our stay fabulous.
reviews.title: Best hotel and service in the area.

reviews.text: I was able to obtain a very reasonable rate off priceline for this hotel and for what I paid I definitely got the best end of the deal. The service was fantastic all around. Room was a bit small but well furnished with comfy beds and very clean. Nice big flat screen tvs and a computer for internet even though it cost money. They have free wine from 5 to 6 every evening and since it was the christmas season they had hot toddies too. I didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel restaurant which got very good reviews. I was given a late checkout when I asked and was able to leave my room for the short walk to the metro to catch my flight at Reagan. My only complaint was everytime the door to the room next to me closed it was so loud it sounded like it was my room door. It didn't help that the person in this room couldn't decide if they wanted to be in or out of their room. Oh and I didn't get to try the spa either unfortunately.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was simply stunning. Even though we didn't get the room with the roof top terrace, we were sitll upgraded to the best room in the hotel (301). The interior of the room was really nice and clean. The fire pit attached to the lobby was a nice feature too.
reviews.title: Very friendly and attentive!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I want to take this opportunity to thank the on duty manager, Danielle who was Very friendly and attentive to all of our requests!!!!!!! You really made our stay memorable. We just checked out and we already miss you! Best stay in DC and VA! We will be back!
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!!

reviews.text: Room was fabulous - clean and chic! Gym was well equipped. Staff were extremely helpful and always welcoming. Made work feel like a vacation!!
reviews.title: Ease the pain of Navy beating Army.

reviews.text: Beautifully decorated boutique hotel in the heart of Alexandria, VA. Valet parking me greeted me by the roadside. He called the front desk and my room key was ready when I walked in the door. My room on the 5th flloor was nice and quite.I enjoyed the Gym and Sauna every evening. Manager's cocktail hour is between 5 & 6 pm. The two resturants on the property serve delicious food. Bravo does not have vegetarian entree on the menu but they prepare one on request.
reviews.title: Simple elegance - my new favorite in Alexandria, VA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this room even though I am a Hilton Honors member. The price was comparabel to Hilton during the time of booking.
reviews.title: Great Dog Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for my husband's 40th. The staff was so friendly from the moment we arrived. Our dog got a welcome holiday bag. There was free wine for happy hour and the rooms were great. When I registared online I mentioned my husband's birthday and they welcomed him with a Happy Birthday and sent champagne and strawberries to our room. One of the staff also emailed me prior to our visit to see if we wanted recommendations on dinner. We are from the area (staying down in Old Town so we didn't have to drive) The hotel is a :15 from the water but it is a great location and for the area a great price. I loved this hotel
reviews.title: Back Again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I (over 60 years, attorney and architect) stayed for 10 days over the Thanksgiving holiday. The service was wonderful. The hotel is lovely. The beds were very comfortable. The location is wonderful. There is a very well equipted health club that I used and enjoyed greatly. We were close to the subway and also rented a car that was parked by the valet and always available on time. The Brabo restaurant was exquisite. The food there and at the "tasting room" was excellent. A true pleasure. I have nothing but praise. I have often spent more for a hotel, but I can't remember an all around better experience. I'll be using other Kimpton properties in there future. When I returned home, I was called by the housekeeping dept. I forgot bracelet in the safe and they were trying to return it!
reviews.title: Our wedding night was nothing special.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was coming down with a cold, so rather than spending Christmas night with my mom and the rest of the family at the house that mom keeps cranked up to 85 degrees, my husband and I decided at the last minute to go to the Lorien Hotel. Since we were traveling with dogs, Kimpton's open pet policy is great.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel & fantastic service - in other words, typical Kimpton

reviews.text: We arrived Christmas evening after spending the day with family at mom's house, just a short jog down the road. Valet and check-in were very fast --- great, because I was exhausted. The front desk staff upgraded us to a suite and offered dog beds for our pets. We were told that the only problem with the room was that the terrace door was busted, so we would not be able to go out onto it. That was fine with us --- we weren't expecting a terrace in the first place.
reviews.title: Nice hotel except for the smell and being walked in on..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two comfy dog beds were promptly delivered up --- my dogs loved these --- although Willie kept wanting whichever one Jake was on.
reviews.title: A Perfect Experience!

reviews.text: The room was a king suite with three distinct rooms: living room, bedroom and bathroom. Big, flat screen TVs in both the living and bedrooms. Free computer at desk in living room. And, as an In-touch member, I received a $10 "raid the minibar" coupon.
reviews.title: Excellent Base for Exploring Old Town Alexandria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had nice amenities and a huge shower with a separate rain shower option. The sink was concrete. Aveda bath products were provided. The closet had robes and we were able to settle in to a nice relaxing evening.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and staff

reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend stay. Staff is exceptional and rooms are comfortable. Location is ideal and most everything is within walking distance. There is complimentary tea and coffee served every morning in the "living room" which is a warm and pleasant room to take a break. Complimentary wine is served from 5-6pm. I did not avail myself of the spa but it seemed very nice. It is a great place to stay. Terry T..
reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Lorien

reviews.text: This weekend was an annual girlfriend getaway. We found a great deal on Sniqueaway and since one of our party had been at the Lorien once before, she highly recommended that we sign up for this deal. The Lorien is in the heart of Old Town Alexandria on King Street. They have curbside valets who are truly treasures. They are friendly and quick to help with any request. As you walk through the European-type courtyard and approach the front door, it magically opens because someone at the front desk saw you coming and invited you into the hotel.
reviews.title: Unbelievable experience!

reviews.text: At the front desk, the personnel is knowledgeable, accommodating and always available. Some of the things the front desk did for us included directing us to great restaurants and sights in the area, offering to provide a ride to a local movie theatre rather than us taking the Metro, and compensating us by waiving parking/movie fees for missing a wake-up call.
reviews.title: Perfect and Amazing

reviews.text: The amenities are comfortable and special. The hotel has a spa that we did not use. They also have an exercise room that has TVs for every machine and provide headphones for those that forgot to bring them. The treadmill was easy to operate and provided a great 30 minute workout. In the rooms, there is a computer provided for your convenience with free internet access as well as a very big screen TV. I brought my own computer and had a very easy time logging on to the internet. The beds were so comfortable and the temperature easy to control. Not to mention the wine hour at 5pm and tea and coffee in the living room in the morning.
reviews.title: Amazing Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provides a whole host of things for their guests as complimentary. Such things as a bed wedge to prop you up to read and a Belgian Chocolate Pillow which is a supplement to assist in a restful and relaxing sleep.
reviews.title: Outstanding
Above and beyond
reviews.text: The Lorien is a pleasure! I have stayed here multiple times over the last couple years (our headquarters office is walking distance in Old Town and it is right by the Metro), and can only say that all other hotels need to visit this one for a lesson in exemplary hospitality. On my most recent trip, the very nice gentleman at the front desk informed me that I was being upgraded to a suite in the hotel (which has an amazing balcony by the way). He then suggested he should complete the first class treatment with a complementary drink in the bar. Seriously? The suite wasn't enough? Believe me, no one at a Westin airport is treating me like this. This was heaven! And that's another great selling point about Kimpton hotels in general, and the Lorien in particular. The hotel bar is classy. There's no lecherous businessmen lurking in the corners, but locals and plenty of mixed comapny so you feel perfectly comfortable having a drink or dinner by yourself. First rate all the way around. I highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Lorien Hotel is my Home away from Home
reviews.text: I have now enjoyed 2 different stays at the Lorien while on business in the DC area and it is perfect in so many ways...close proximity to my clients, FANTASTIC staff Maria, Danielle, Mitch and Omar, and wonderful CLEAN & RELAXING rooms! It is so nice to come back to the hotel to relax after intense meetings and of course the DC traffic!! Again, this is the place for me when I travel to and around the DC area. Thanks Again Lorien Hotel Staff.

reviews.title: Kimpton's Lorien is an absolute pleasure
reviews.text: I live in hotels 4-6 months of each year and truly appreciate the comfort, peace of mind and ease that well managed hotels offer. The Lorien is impeccably maintained, efficiently run, perfectly located and comfortable with a touch of elegance. I travelled on business, with two pets in tow, and my stay was both relaxing and productive. I regret that my schedule didn't permit a spa visit--the spa services looked great and the prices seemed very reasonable. Coffee in the morning and wine in the evening are always a plus at Kimpton Hotels. The Lorien's location in Old Town Alexandria, a city with great charm and history, and a stone's throw from the DC metro is ideal. The staff is professional, courteous, and knowledgable.

reviews.title: Fantastic for Business or Pleasure!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Lorien for business. I love that they offer rooms at government rates so that I stay within my spending limit, but I still get the boutique hotel service! I arrived very late at night and the valet and front desk staff were very pleasant and immediately responsive. In fact, throughout my stay, the front desk staff recognized me and made polite conversation, and were always very professional. It really made my experience better knowing that they were interested in their guests. I love that the hotel is located within walking distance (5 mins) of the Metro...it means I can finish my meetings and get back in time for wine hour after work! It goes without saying that the guest rooms are fabulous, very posh and comfortable.

reviews.title: Girlfriend Getaway
reviews.text: Had such a wonderful , actually perfect, stay at the Loiren Hotel. A chic, luxurious, and immaculate boutique hotel that was the perfect setting for a girlfriend getaway. The hotel staff made us feel pampered and the spa was a dreamy experience. I would highly recommend this hotel for a special getaway with your spouse, too. Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.title: Second review - still love this place
reviews.text: Great stay. Got a smaller room this time. More like a standard in most hotels. The extra touches seem to have been diminished a bit. The quality of the toiletries is down. The robes a bit scratchier than the usual Kimpton product. The sleep menu no longer offers a white noise machine. That said - still a great hotel. It is still a wonderful, comfortable stay. The service is still impeccable. The wine reception quite enjoyable. In room compujter access a treat.

reviews.title: Quick trip to the Lorien Hotel in Alexandria, VA
reviews.text: We had a weekend stay at the Lorien Hotel that ended up being one night. That was not the fault of the hotel, but the weather. The room was beautiful, but narrow. The entrance to the bathroom was a very large door that slid open. The only complaint was the lack of light in the bathroom. My wife was beside herself due to darkness of the bath. I would give it 4 stars if there were more wattage

reviews.title: Modern Medocrity
reviews.text: This modern hotel shows so much potential. For a kimpton hotel it seemed a little out of touch compared with its sister hotel, the Monaco, right down the street. it seemed as if the front desk was constantly overwhelmed but was always trying very hard. Twice a specific request was made but was apparently ignored. I stayed in the Lorien suite that could of been a knockout of a room if it was more furnished. On a positive note, The valet staff were awesome.

reviews.title: Oasis away from the Hustle and Bustle of DC
reviews.text: We picked the Lorien because it was so much cheaper than the hotels in DC. Then, after reading a lot of the opinions on staying in Alexandra vs Washington, I began to regret our decision.

reviews.title: Nice but disappointing
reviews.text: However, once we arrived I was very happy with our choice. The hotel is very nice and looks and feels brand new. The rooms are clean and bright and extremely comfortable.

reviews.title: Spa was a huge disappointment
reviews.text: I meant to write this review upon completion of my trip last year but now that I am researching taking another trip figured better late than never. I decided to book a local trip in order to stay close in case family needed me and was very excited to get away with relaxation being the main focus. I chose Lorien because of there being a spa right on site. I will start with the good, the hotel itself was WONDERFUL. Very clean, very comfortable and I found the front desk staff to be VERY accommodating but if you are booking this property for use of the spa I would perhaps try another property and take your spa services elsewhere.

reviews.title: Better than home.
reviews.text: I booked a massage well in advance of my visit and paid quite a bit of money only to be very disappointed. I found the steam room to be dirty and my massage (if you can call it that) to be one of the worst I've ever had. The woman who provided the massage decided to focus heavily on sacrocranial massage (something that was not even written in the description of services, let alone told to me before starting). Basically it consisted of her holding her hands over various parts of my body to transmit energy. While I believe very much in alternative methods of therapy, I was looking for a good old massage and did not get what I paid a very expensive price for.

reviews.title: excellent service, amenities, location, food, wine and value!!!
reviews.text: I told the front desk upon check out and they told me they would have a spa manager call me. Good news - she did, within an hour of check out. Bad news - when I tried to return her call that was the last I heard of my complaint even though she mentioned in her previous message wanting to provide me with a free massage in the future to keep me as a return customer of Lorien.

reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!
reviews.text: Now that a year has gone by and the situation was not rectified, it looks like eventhough I'm making this an annual trip, I will not be staying at the Lorien and will take my spa business elsewhere.

reviews.title: Another great stay!
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed here on three separate occasions (one of which was our wedding night) and can't say enough in support of the Lorien. This hotel is spotless and beautiful, has a great location, excellent food at Brabo and the Brabo Tasting Room, and best of all provides personalized, unpretentious, responsive service for a price that is reasonable for this class of establishment. The Lorien is a five minute walk from the Metro, and King Street has an impressive variety of restaurants and activities. We once brought our dog and, as with all Kimptons, he received a lovely reception. Unlike many hotels, the "dog" room was of the same quality as its non-pet counterparts, and actually larger. Plus, no one can argue with a free happy hour. Great place, will keep going back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to Shane and Omar for great, friendly customer service at check-in. In fact, everyone on staff was very pleasant. Location, comfort, and spa-like style are nice alternatives to Kimpton’s sibling property, the Hotel Monico (with its funky vibe.) I can’t pick a favorite between the two. And, stating the obvious, join the Kimpton loyalty program, “InTouch.” The little perks that even an infrequent traveler receives are pretty sweet.
reviews.title: Style, service and location.

reviews.text: Besides a location near the King Street Metro (guaranteeing access to all-things Washington), there’s a Crate and Barrel Outlet around the corner. The drive to the Birchmere (live music most nights) was surprisingly easy, even at 5:00 pm on a weeknight. Self-parking isn’t an option at the Lorien, but the valet service was fast and convenient.
reviews.title: Excellant hotel and they welcome your pet as well!

reviews.text: This hotel makes you feel right at home from making your experience personal to welcoming your pet. You can count on it being clean and they will accommodate your needs. This hotel is in a great location for shopping and eating out all within walking distance but you won't want to miss their Brabo dining experience.
reviews.title: A Most-Enjoyable Birthday Weekend!

reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this hotel and spa! The staff was exceptional...everyone greeted me with a smile, and was more than willing to make me feel like I was the most important guest in the hotel. From check-in to check-out, I felt like a VIP guest! My room was beautiful and clean. The bathroom was well equipped with all the extras you may need during your stay, with tons of other options available upon request. The mini-bar had a variety of snacks, drinks, cocktails, etc. with organic options, as well. The spa was heavenly...I was perfectly pampered! I can't think of anything negative to say. Lorien Hotel & Spa has my highest recommendation!!! Top-notch experience!!!
reviews.title: My favorite DC Area Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lorien is a boutique hotel located near the metro station in old town Alexandria. The location makes it easy to get into DC or to stroll King's Street to shop or have a meal at one of the great restaurants close by. The staff at the Lorien is second to none. They are friendly, competent and accommodating. When you walk in, you are always greeted by the great front desk personnel. The rooms are spotless and smell heavenly. Every room has a large flat screen television, a computer and a clock radio that can also serve as a docking station for your ipod. There are large comfy bathrobes in the closet and heavenly shower heads in the bathroom. The pillows and linens make the beds a dream to sleep in. If you really want to treat yourself, have a massage in the on site spa. The last massage I had there was great. I have stayed at this hotel at least six times and I have never had a bad experience.
reviews.title: Simply Outstanding

description: Centrally located in Old Town Alexandria, our luxury boutique hotel is a collaborative dream. Renowned interior designer Vicente Wolf created a space that is reflective of the past and grounded in modern sensibilities. Combined with the stylish calm of our spa, our destination restaurant, BRABO by Robert Wiedmaier, a striking environment and the amenities expected of a Kimpton Hotel, Lorien Hotel & Spa unites the elegance of yesteryear with the comforts of modern-day living.
